body:
Comment 6 by **mebibou**: 
Ok so I updated and tried again, and this time I have the following error:

In file included from ../../../gccgo/libgo/runtime/malloc.c:12:0:
../../../gccgo/libgo/runtime/malloc.h:392:7: error: conflicting types for ‘mlookup’
../../../gccgo/libgo/runtime/go-alloc.h:12:16: note: previous declaration of
‘mlookup’ was here
../../../gccgo/libgo/runtime/malloc.c:21:1: error: conflicting types for ‘__go_alloc’
../../../gccgo/libgo/runtime/go-alloc.h:10:14: note: previous declaration of
‘__go_alloc’ was here
../../../gccgo/libgo/runtime/malloc.c:123:1: error: conflicting types for ‘mlookup’
../../../gccgo/libgo/runtime/go-alloc.h:12:16: note: previous declaration of
‘mlookup’ was here
cc1: warnings being treated as errors
../../../gccgo/libgo/runtime/malloc.c: In function ‘mlookup’:
../../../gccgo/libgo/runtime/malloc.c:160:4: error: format ‘%zd’ expects type
‘signed size_t’, but argument 5 
has type ‘uintptr’
../../../gccgo/libgo/runtime/malloc.c: At top level:
../../../gccgo/libgo/runtime/malloc.c:178:1: error: constructor priorities are not
supported
../../../gccgo/libgo/runtime/malloc.c: In function ‘stackalloc’:
../../../gccgo/libgo/runtime/malloc.c:281:4: error: format ‘%zu’ expects type
‘size_t’, but argument 2 has type 
‘uintptr’
make[3]: *** [malloc.lo] Error 1
make[2]: *** [all] Error 2
make[1]: *** [all-target-libgo] Error 2
make: *** [all] Error 2

It seems like the other one, but at a different step.
